intro: Trichodium alpinum var. flavidum, commonly known as the yellow moss cushion, is a rare and specialized plant found in alpine environments. It belongs to the family Hypnaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form. The plant has small, yellowish-green leaves that are tightly packed, forming a compact structure that helps retain moisture in harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental change.
